Question_1.Context: In agriculture, replanting problems can occur when the same species is planted in the same soil repeatedly, leading to decreased plant health and increased production costs.
Question_1.Question: What issue is associated with replanting ramet seedlings in the original planting hole?
Question_1.A: They grow more vigorously each year
Question_1.B: They weaken year-by-year until their death
Question_1.C: They become more resistant to diseases
Question_1.D: They increase the land utilisation rate
Question_1.Source: If ramet seedlings are replanted in the original planting hole, they weaken year-by-year until their death, which reduces the land utilisation rate and increases the production costs.

Question_2.Context: Exogenous lactic acid bacteria can be applied to soil to improve its quality and alleviate certain agricultural problems.
Question_2.Question: What is the main component of the exogenous lactic acid bacteria used to improve planting soil?
Question_2.Source: In this study, exogenous lactic acid bacteria (LAB, the main component is Lactobacillus plantarum) were applied to improve the planting soil of herbaceous peony.

Question_3.Context: The application of certain bacteria to soil can influence the growth and flowering of plants.
Question_3.Question: Which herbaceous peony cultivar showed increased plant height and flowering rate after LAB treatment?
Question_3.Source: The results showed that after LAB treatment, the plant height, flowering rate, other morphological indexes and root vitality of 'Hongxiuqiu' were increased.

Question_4.Context: Soil nutrients and enzyme activity are important for the health and growth of plants.
Question_4.Question: Which herbaceous peony cultivar's rhizosphere soil nutrient content and enzyme activity were most improved after LAB treatment?
Question_4.Source: The 'Dafugui' rhizosphere soil nutrient content and enzyme activity were improved, followed by 'Hongxiuqiu' and 'Zifengyu'.

Question_5.Context: Plant hormones like salicylic acid and abscisic acid play roles in plant stress responses and development.
Question_5.Question: What was the effect of LAB treatment on the rhizosphere soil free salicylic acid content and root abscisic acid content?
Question_5.C: Salicylic acid increased and abscisic acid decreased
Question_5.D: Salicylic acid decreased and abscisic acid increased
Question_5.Source: The rhizosphere soil free salicylic acid content and root abscisic acid content decreased.

Question_6.Context: The presence of certain compounds in the soil can indicate improved soil health and plant resilience.
Question_6.Question: Which of the following increased in the soil after LAB treatment?
Question_6.Source: The soil bacterial abundance, root antioxidant enzyme activity, proline and paeoniflorin content increased in all varieties.

Question_7.Context: The application of beneficial microorganisms to soil can enhance the ornamental value of plants by affecting their growth and development.
Question_7.Question: What was one of the outcomes of LAB application on herbaceous peony?
Question_7.Source: This study found that LAB application can improve soil fertility and enzyme activity, promote the growth and development of herbaceous peony, increase the flowering rate and improve the ornamental value.

Question_8.Context: Different plant varieties may respond differently to the same soil treatment.
Question_8.Question: What did the study suggest about the influence of LAB on different herbaceous peony varieties?
Question_8.B: The influence of LAB varied among varieties
Question_8.C: LAB had no influence on any variety
Question_8.D: Only one variety showed a positive response
Question_8.Source: However, the influence of LAB on different herbaceous peony varieties varied.

Question_9.Context: Optimizing the application of soil amendments can be crucial for achieving the desired effects on plant growth and health.
Question_9.Question: What does the text suggest is necessary for the application of LAB to alleviate replanting problems?
Question_9.B: Optimising the application concentration and frequency
Question_9.D: Using LAB without other soil treatments
Question_9.Source: Therefore, it is necessary to further expand the number of varieties, optimise the application concentration and frequency of LAB application.

Question_10.Context: The content of certain amino acids and secondary metabolites in plants can be indicative of their stress tolerance and overall health.
Question_10.Question: Which compound, associated with stress tolerance in plants, increased in content after LAB treatment?
Question_10.Source: The soil bacterial abundance, root antioxidant enzyme activity, proline and paeoniflorin content increased in all varieties.
